question: During exams, my hands sweat or I feel stiffness in my hands and/or arms.
I think the teacher is constantly watching me during the exam.
When I start reading the exam, my vision blurs and I don't understand what I'm reading.
While taking the exam, I think I'm doing very badly.
If I'm 5 minutes late for an exam, I don't go in, I hide in the school or try to leave.
When a group of classmates talks about the exam before the teacher arrives, I get more nervous.
For me, it's a relief or comfort when, for any reason, an exam is postponed.
I can't sleep the night before an exam.
I think I won't be able to pass the exam, even if I've studied.
At the beginning of the exam, as soon as I read the questions, I hand it in blank to the teacher and go back to my seat.
When I'm taking an exam, my heart beats very fast.
After taking an exam, I feel like I did terribly and think about disappearing or hurting myself.
It's difficult or impossible for me to eat before taking an exam.
I get sick and come up with excuses not to take an exam.
In the hours/moments leading up to the exam, I feel stomach discomfort or it gets upset and I have to go to the bathroom.
I take a long time to decide to answer most of the questions or to turn in the exam.
Before entering the exam, I talk very fast and move more than usual.
During exams, I have difficulty concentrating and sometimes I freeze.
I establish a pre-exam ritual and if I can't follow it, I come up with an excuse and don't take the exam.
While taking an exam, I can't stay still, I tend to bite my nails or the pen...
